DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate analgesic efficacy safety two dose oxymorphone immediate release ( IR ) compare placebo oxycodone post-surgical pain .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Oxymorphone Immediate Release Post-surgical Acute Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Following abdominal surgery sufficient washout post-surgical analgesia , patient randomize one follow four treatment group ; 1 ) oxymorphone IR 10 mg , 2 ) oxymorphone IR 20 mg , 3 ) oxycodone IR 15 mg , 4 ) placebo . Total duration treatment 48 hour . Patients require take study medication every 4-6 hour . After first dose , periodic pain assessment perform first six hour . Subsequently , patient require assess current pain intensity average pain intensity since last dose study medication prior every dose .
DOC.criteria: Male female patient 18 year age old Patients undergo surgery abdominal incision least 3 cm expect hospitalize least 36 hour expect subsequently require least 48 hour oral opioid therapy . Washout least 45 minute parenteral 4 hour IM analgesia . Initial pain intensity score least 50 mm 100mm VAS categorical pain rating moderate severe scale none , mild , moderate , severe . Written informed consent . Known allergy significant reaction opioids . History chronic opioid use opioid abuse within 6 month prior study entry . History alcohol substance abuse within last 3 year . Have participant study investigational drug device within 30 day prior study entry . Have previous participant oxymorphone clinical trial . Are currently take take monoamine oxidase inhibitor ( MAOI ) drug within 2 week prior study entry . Are currently take take St. John 's Wort > 1000 mg/day within 2 day prior study entry . Use longacting oral parenteral analgesic ( opioid , nonopioid nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug [ NSAID ] ) within 12 hour ( least 24 hour cyclooxygenase2 [ COX 2 ] analgesic ) prior receive study medication . Are stabilize follow medication least 4 week prior dose : tricyclic antidepressant drug ; serotonin reuptake inhibitor ; amphetamine use attentiondeficit hyperactivity disorder ( ADHD ) Have history seizure .
